1.name: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari
1.description: Hypnotist Dr. Caligari uses a somnambulist, Cesare, to commit murders.

2.name: The Golem
2.description: In 16th-century Prague, a rabbi creates the Golem - a giant creature made of clay. Using sorcery, he brings the creature to life in order to protect the Jews of Prague from persecution.

3.name: Way Down East
3.description: A naive country girl is tricked into a sham marriage by a wealthy womanizer, then must rebuild her life despite the taint of having borne a child out of wedlock.

4.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
4.description: Dr. Henry Jekyll experiments with scientific means of revealing the hidden, dark side of man and releases a murderer from within himself.

5.name: Sex
5.description: A broadway actress uses her sex appeal to ruin a marriage only to dump her lover for a richer prospect.

6.name: The Mark of Zorro
6.description: A seemingly idiotic fop is really the courageous vigilante Zorro, who seeks to protect the oppressed.

7.name: Within Our Gates
7.description: Abandoned by her fiancé, an educated black woman with a shocking past dedicates herself to helping a near bankrupt school for impoverished black youths.

8.name: The Penalty
8.description: A deformed criminal mastermind plans to loot the city of San Francisco as well as revenge himself on the doctor who mistakenly amputated his legs.

9.name: The Son of Tarzan
9.description: The scenario follows the book closely. Tarzan's son Jack (Korak to the apes) is kidnapped from England by Tarzan's old enemy Paulovich. He escapes into the African jungle with the help of ...                See full summary »

10.name: The Last of the Mohicans
10.description: As Alice and Cora Munro attempt to find their father, a British officer in the French and Indian War, they are set upon by French soldiers and their cohorts, Huron tribesmen led by the evil...                See full summary »

11.name: Billions
11.description: Billions is a lost 1920 American silent comedy film produced by and starring Alla Nazimova and distributed by Metro Pictures. Ray Smallwood directed. It is based on a French play, L'Homme riche, by Jean Jose Frappa and Henry Dupuy-Mazuel.

12.name: Erotikon
12.description: EROTIKON surely pushed the boundaries of what was acceptable on the screen in 1920: Irene, the bored wife of a distracted entomologist, pursues a womanizing aviator, but she may actually be...                See full summary »

13.name: Genuine
13.description: Extremely rare work of Robert Wiene. From the director and year of excellent "The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari" this work was eventually overshadowed by the success of Caligari. It has a dreamy atmosphere, like another world or something.

14.name: Why Change Your Wife?
14.description: Robert and Beth Gordon are married but share little. He runs into Sally at a cabaret and the Gordons are soon divorced. Just as he gets bored with Sally's superficiality, Beth strives to ...                See full summary »

15.name: Shakuntala
15.description: Raja Dushyanta is out hunting in a nearby forest happens upon an attractive maiden, named Shakuntala, and instantly falls in love with her. He gives Shakuntala his ring as a symbol of his ...                See full summary »

16.name: The Saphead
16.description: The simple-minded son of a rich financier must find his own way in the world.

17.name: The Head of Janus
17.description: See everything in the book "Conrad Veidt on Screen" by John T. Soister (McFarland 2002), pages 109-113.

18.name: Pollyanna
18.description: An orphan's optimistic outlook brings a change to the ill-tempered town in which she resides to her aunt.

19.name: Outside the Law
19.description: In this early collaboration with director Tod Browning (Dracula, Freaks), Chaney delivers a dual performance of dramatic intensity, starring as Ah Wing, a kind-hearted student of Confucian ...                See full summary »

20.name: Leaves From Satan's Book
20.description: In 4 episodic tales of human suffering; the temptation of Jesus, the Spanish Inquisition, the French Revolution and the Russo-Finnish war of 1918, Satan attempts to win God's favor.

21.name: The Parson's Widow
21.description: A young man is elected by a small village to be its parson. As part of his duties, he is required to marry the widow of the parson before him. This poses two problems--first, the widow is ...                See full summary »

22.name: Das wandernde Bild
22.description: Mia May has surrendered herself to a disciple of free love, and, having given birth to a child, marries the twin brother and Doppelgänger of her chosen lover.

23.name: The Flapper
23.description: Ginger grows up in a slow town. Because of her wild attitude, her father decides to send her to a strict boarding school. Despite the strictness, the girls have fun getting into flapper lifestyle trouble including flirting.

24.name: The Revenge of Tarzan
24.description: Tarzan and Jane are sailing for France in answer to a call for help from Countess de Coude who is being persecuted by her brother Rokoff. After a duel with the Countess' jealous husband, ...                See full summary »

25.name: Gyurkovicsarna
25.description: Film adaptation of the novel "A Gyurkovics-fiúk' by author Ferenc Herczeg, starring Gösta Ekman in the lead role, and featuring opera singer Emile Stiebel.

26.name: On with the Dance
26.description: Sonia, a Russian dancer, comes to New York seeking her fortune. She marries Peter Derwynt, a young architect, but their marriage is not a good one. Sonia falls under the spell of a rich ...                See full summary »

27.name: Opium
27.description: A Chinese opium dealer takes revenge on Westerners who have corrupted his wife.

28.name: The Daughter of Dawn
28.description: This restored silent film features a love triangle involving a Kiowa chief's daughter and ensuing conflict between Kiowa and Comanche villages.

29.name: Sumurun
29.description: The favorite slave girl of a tyrannical sheik falls in love with a cloth merchant. Meanwhile, a hunchback clown suffers unrequited love for a traveling dancer who wants to join the harem.

30.name: Anna Boleyn
30.description: The story of the ill-fated second wife of the English king Henry VIII, whose marriage to the Henry led to momentous political and religious turmoil in England.

31.name: Go and Get It
31.description: An intrepid newspaper reporter attempts to solve a series of murders committed by a gorilla carrying the transplanted brain of a human.

32.name: Die Spinnen, 2. Teil - Das Brillantenschiff
32.description: Kay Hoog wants to stop the organisation "Die Spinnen" to get a certain diamond, that will give the owning woman the crown of Asia, but the man, who should be the owner of that diamond, ...                See full summary »

33.name: The Mollycoddle
33.description: An American who has lived much of his life outside the country returns to Arizona for the first time in years and encounters villainy.

34.name: Treasure Island
34.description: Young Jim Hawkins is caught up with the pirate Long John Silver in search of the buried treasure of the buccaneer Captain Flint, in this adaptation of the classic novel by Robert Louis ...                See full summary »

35.name: Headin' Home
35.description: The "true story" of baseball great Babe Ruth; Ruth plays himself.

36.name: From Morn to Midnight
36.description: A Cashier in a bank in a small German town is alerted to the power of money by the visit of a rich Italian lady. He embezzles 60, 000 Marks and leaves for the capital city, where he ...                See full summary »

39.name: The Round-Up
39.description: An overweight sheriff does his best to assist a man accused of theft.

40.name: The Man from Snowy River
40.description: A country boy, Jim Conroy, is living a dissolute life in the city, running around with vamp Helen Ross. When his father cuts him off, he is dumped by Helen and returns to the bush.

41.name: The Woman in the Suitcase
41.description: Mary Moreland discovers the photograph of a woman not her mother in her father's suitcase and sets out to find her in hopes of returning her father to his rightful place in the family.

42.name: The Twelve Pound Look
42.description: A self-made man divorces his wife who becomes a typist and warns him his second wife may leave him too.

43.name: Over the Hill to the Poorhouse
43.description: The mother of a large family is abandoned by her children and faces consignment to the poorhouse. But one of her offspring, the one no one had faith in, returns to rescue her.

44.name: The Symbol of the Unconquered
44.description: Racists learn that the land a negro owns lies over a vast oil field, and threaten his life when he refuses to sell.

45.name: The Hunchback and the Dancer
45.description: Wilton, a hunchback, who was always scorned and ridiculed by women, returns from Java a rich man after having discovered a diamond mine. He romances Gina, who is on the rebound from a ...                See full summary »

46.name: Satanas
46.description: A three-part historical film, with episode one taking place in ancient Egypt, the second is based on the Hugo novel, and the third episode takes place during the 1917 Russian revolution.

47.name: The Virgin of Stamboul
47.description: Achmet Bey, a Turkish chieftain, catches one of his many wives in adultery and murders her lover. Throwing aside the cuckolding wife, he abducts his harem an innocent girl. However, a brave...                See full summary »

48.name: Der Richter von Zalamea
48.description: Spain at the beginning of the 1580s, at the time of Philip II. The troops of the king entered the village of Zalamea. Captain Don Alvaro is quartered in the house of Pedro Crespo and his ...                See full summary »

49.name: Wuthering Heights
49.description: The first screen adaptation of Emily Bronte's book about star cross'd lovers who demolish themselves and everyone around them with their self-destructive love.

50.name: Down on the Farm
50.description: The day starts off as any normal day on Roach's farm, where Teddy, the farmhouse dog, is doing more productive work than everyone else combined. But the day changes when Roach's farmhand ...                See full summary »
